msContents.summary: Legal instrument dated Jan. 22, 1464, issued by Rodrigo Sánchez de Arévalo, bishop of Osma and Castilian ambassador to the papal curia (1456-1470). Contains an authenticated copy of a privilege granted to Giacomo di Nanni Todeschini Piccolomini di Castiglia e d'Aragona, nephew of Pope Pius II, by King Henry IV of Castile at Aranda (near Osma), dated Feb. 9, 1463. The privilege appoints Giacomo as Henry IV's councilor, and entitles him to join the name Castiglia to his name, as well as add the Castilian arms to his own. The document records the delivery of the royal privilege to Giacomo.
